SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Types of Products for B2B Commerce for Visualforce

A product on a B2B Commerce for Visualforce storefront can range from a single physical item to multiple items bundled and sold together. For the items you’re selling, choose the product configuration that best suits your storefront users’ shopping experience.

REQUIRED EDITIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)
Definitions of Composite and Component Products

Several product types combine details from multiple product records into a single buying experience. B2B Commerce for Visualforce defines these relationships with the following terms:

Composite
The product is a parent that contains two or more child (component) products.
Component
The product is a child of a parent (composite) product.

The following related lists on a product record specify a product's composite or component relationship to other products:

Composite Products (Component)
The parent (composite) product records for which the current product is a child (component). For example, if the current product is part of a bundle, this related list shows the bundle.
Composite Products
The child (component) products for which the current product is a parent (composite). For example, if the current product is the bundle, this related list shows the component products included in the bundle.
Comparison of Product Types
PRODUCT TYPE	USE CASE	EXAMPLE	SKU	PRICE DEPENDS ON
Product	A single item, sold by itself.	A single bag of coffee beans.	SKU for each product.	A price list item assigned to the product.
Bundle	Two or more products that you group as a single purchasable item. A bundle can include an exclusive item that isn’t available outside of the bundle.	Assortment of coffee beans (multiple bags).	
SKU for bundle.
SKU for each component product.
	A price list item assigned to the bundle. The bundle's price is independent of its component products’ price list items.
Kit	Two or more products that you group as a single purchasable item. By default, a kit can't include an exclusive item that isn’t available outside of the kit.	A coffee starter kit including grinder, press, and two bags of coffee beans.	
SKU for kit.
SKU for each component product.
	The sum of the component products' price list items. The price list item assigned to the kit product has a price value of 0.
Dynamic Kit	Two or more products that a storefront user selects from groups of options that you provide. The selections become a single purchasable item.	A build-your-own coffee starter kit, where a storefront user can choose their grinder, press, and beans from lists of available options.	
SKU for dynamic kit.
SKU for each component product.
	The sum of price list items for whichever component products the storefront user selects. The price list item assigned to the dynamic kit product has a price value of 0.
Aggregated	A single product with variations or styles that a storefront user can select. The product specs apply to all styles, but you want to provide an easy way to select a particular color, size, finish, and so on. Each variation is a separately managed product record with a unique price.	A coffee press that is available in different finishes, such as stainless steel or copper.	
SKU for aggregated product.
SKU for each component product.
	The price list item of whichever variation the storefront user selected. The price list item assigned to the aggregated product has a price value of 0.
Assembly	A product that’s assembled from other individually purchasable products. You can provide an interactive diagram that shows the assembled product and its component products.	A coffee press that can be purchased assembled, or whose component parts (glass, filters, handle) can be purchased separately.	
SKU for assembly product.
SKU for each component product.
	A price list item assigned to the assembly product. The assembly product's price is independent of its component products’ price list items.
NOTE The following product types appear in the Product Type picklist on a CC Product record, but aren’t valid selections.
Coupon
Plan
Plan Options
Accessories
Training
Configurable

B2B Commerce for Visualforce uses the Coupon product type only when processing shopping cart items when a coupon is applied. The Coupon type isn’t valid when manually creating a product record.

Create a Product for Your Storefront
For a product sold by itself, setup is easy. Don't worry about composite products or component products—create just one product record with all the details.
Create a Bundle
Combine two or more existing standard product SKUs into a single purchasable item. A bundle's price is independent of its component products’ price list items. For example, if your storefront individually sells multiple types of coffee beans, you can group several varieties together and sell the bundle at a discounted price. A bundle can include an exclusive item that isn’t available outside of the bundle.
Create a Kit
Combine two or more existing standard product SKUs into a single purchasable item. A kit's price is always the sum of the component products' price list items. By default, a kit can't include an exclusive item that isn’t available outside of the kit.
Create a Dynamic Kit
Let buyers build a custom kit by selecting products from groups of options you provide. For example, allow buyers to easily select their own coffee supplies by choosing a dispenser, a grinder, multiple varieties of beans, and any optional accessories. You can require buyers to make at least one selection from a group, and allow multiple selections from a group. A dynamic kit's price is the sum of the price list items for whichever component products the storefront user selects.
Create an Aggregated Product
Make it easy for buyers to select a particular color, finish, size, or other characteristic of a product that comes in multiple styles. Manage the specs or other product details in one aggregated record, but specify a SKU and price for each particular style. For example, let's say that you sell a coffee press that comes in multiple finishes. You can provide a single Product Detail page where a buyer can easily select a particular finish.
Create an Assembly Product
If you sell individual products that comprise a larger product, you can also sell the entire assembled product. An assembly product's price is independent of its component products’ price list items. For example, if your storefront individually sells coffee press parts, you can sell the fully assembled coffee press at a discounted price.
